name: Dark Lore Mysteries: The Hunt For Truth
description: A violent murder has awoken a small town with a troubled past, they thought that chapter was over with, but has it returned?
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 8, 7, Vista, XP Processor: 1.8 Ghz Memory: 1 GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: Integrated Audio or better

reviews.review_text: The story didn't make much sense at all. My character drew a conclusion about who was guilty and I barely even knew who the person was.   The HOG part was fine, standard. I found sometimes the items I clicked on wouldn't register.   The puzzles were pretty typical, although some were buggy. There is one puzzle where you have to draw lines between a peg and a hole using the mouse and it would constantly reset for unknown reasons as soon as I got close to the end. Very frustrating.   There are definitely much better games available.

Fun point and click murder mystery. The story could of been longer and a little more refined, but still good fun. In a city of Pennsylvania, a Magistrate is murdered in a suspected way. You are called in to investigate this murder and discover the secret of this little city. I recommend this game if you are looking for a fun relaxed puzzle game with a nice mystery.

Dark Lore Mysteries is a Hidden Object game with a slow moving story that isn't very challenging. It took me 2 hours to beat (I was watching TV the whole time, so may be able to power through in 1 hour) but the graphics are decent.
